title: Understanding Gas Chromatography
text: Gas chromatography is a technique used to separate and analyze compounds that can be vaporized without decomposition. It is widely used in analytical chemistry for its ability to provide high resolution and sensitivity.

title: Components of Gas Chromatography
text: The main components of a gas chromatograph include the injector, the column, the detector, and the carrier gas. Each plays a crucial role in the separation process.

hintAnswer: To transport the sample through the column
title: Role of the Carrier Gas
text: What is the primary function of the carrier gas in gas chromatography?
choices: To transport the sample through the column

title: Analyzing Volatile Compounds
text: Gas chromatography is particularly effective for analyzing volatile compounds due to its ability to separate them based on their boiling points and interactions with the column's stationary phase.

hintAnswer: High resolution and sensitivity for volatile compounds
title: Advantages of Gas Chromatography
text: What is the main advantage of using gas chromatography in analysis?
choices: High resolution and sensitivity for volatile compounds
Ability to work with aqueous samples
